translated: One copy of the text of the Bodhisattva Precepts
My mind is thirsty and yearning, focusing solely on the Dharma sounds. I only wish that the precepts master will extensively bestow the teachings.
The master said, All bodhisattvas should not kill. Killing will surely lead to falling into a great hell. Killing life
In the next life, one will be repaid with a short life.
In the Saha world, both eyes will be injured and become blind.
I exhort and request all the assembly at the ritual site to jointly sever the karma of killing, without needing to carry it out.
Buddha's disciples, all bodhisattvas should not steal and obtain objects.
Just like a mother who dies young, later one will be reborn as an animal with fur and horns coming to repay.
All day long, driven and pulled without rest.
Without any opportunity to eat water and grass.
Still confused, the mind does not realize.
Therefore, I earnestly report again.
Buddha's disciples.
All bodhisattvas should not engage in sexual misconduct.
Sexual misconduct leads to the inverted root of offenses, and the iron bed and copper pillar come to face each other.
The saw pillar blazes brightly, competing to come and falsely embrace the body, the entire body is all drenched and rotten, it is said.
Why not give rise to the mind of enlightenment?
Buddha's disciples,
all bodhisattvas should not tell lies.
If one claims to have seen what one has not seen,
one's tongue will be plowed with an iron plow.
And a saw will be used to cut off one's eyes for the sake of profit.
If sentient beings deceive their teachers, monks, and parents,
if they are able to repent and endure, they will surely be separated from the suffering of the AvÄ«ci Hell in the future.
Buddha's disciples,
all bodhisattvas should not sell alcohol.
If one sells alcohol, molten copper will be poured into one's mouth.
Flames will shoot out from the soles of one's feet, reaching up to the heavens.
The jail guards will hold spears and cut off one's two hands.
All of this is due to confusion, delusion, and inversion.
One's present body will experience the consequences of one's actions.
One will then be driven into the AvÄ«ci Hell,
with iron walls surrounding one on all sides, leaving no place to escape.
Buddha's disciples,
all bodhisattvas should not boast about themselves.
If one bathes in hot water to atone for one's sins,
it will be like entering the AvÄ«ci Hell for an instant, and one will faint.
Day and night, long nails will be driven into one's eyes and ears, causing one to weep.
Blood, sin, cause of sin, fruit of sin, root of sin, cool.
Then the ox-headed [demons] come to pull out the tongue, not allowing begging for life.
For a while, the jailer holds and makes it leak.
Buddha's disciple.
All bodhisattvas, do not slander others.
The appearance of slandering others will lead to hell.
Swords and knives slander and cause one to cross to the evil realms.
Entering hell, sinking in mud and water, then being ground and blunted like boiling in a cauldron.
All hells are passed through.
Skin, flesh, and blood are like flowing water.
When will he be able to leave the boiling?
Buddha's disciple.
All bodhisattvas, do not be too stingy.
Accumulating many treasures.
Still, in the mountains, seeing poor people come to beg.
Not being able to control greedy thoughts with a needle or a blade of grass.
Not knowing contentment.
In the future, entering the Yellow Springs empty-handed.
Buddha's disciple.
All bodhisattvas, do not be too angry.
Being too angry will definitely lead to being a fleeing snake.
The body writhes and moves like intestines, without hands or feet.
It is said that in past lives, one was angry.
80,000 tubes of pus and blood come to suck and eat.
Leaving behind his own bones, now only skin and bones.
The suffering he endures is difficult to bear.
When will he attain a superior human body again?
Buddha's disciple.
All bodhisattvas should not slander the Three Jewels.
If you slander the Three Jewels, you will fall into the evil paths.
300 copper nails firmly nailed in place.
Screaming and wailing, the sound reaching the heavens, slandering the Buddha.
Slandering and becoming even more angry, copper opens and iron spikes come to oppose each other, painful and sorrowful.
It is impossible to discuss when he will encounter the Way of the Heavenly Palm.
Buddha's disciple.
Harmony says.
From the smallest dust offense up to the darkest, for a thousand lifetimes.
The superior fruits of bodhi are all suddenly lost.
Playing with the six destinies is truly lamentable.
In the heavens and among humans, what path is there to take rebirth?
Harmony says.
Offending the precepts, knowing the retribution has already fallen into the three evil paths.
How many years have passed in the meantime before being reborn?
Harmony says.
Falling into the evil paths has already reached extreme suffering.
Passing through eons, it is truly painful.
Suspecting the years and months to be long, I do not know.
Have you heard the names of your parents and the Three Jewels?
The master said:
Alas, alas!
The master said:
Today I have heard the precepts of the Lotus Treasury.
The assembly all inclines the heart, wishing you to explain in detail.
The master said:
I now repent and dare not conceal.
I only wish that the precept master will have compassion and explain in detail.
The master said:
The great master's secret treasury, the true scriptures of sweet dew.
I rejoice in hearing them now, wishing you to explain in detail.
The master said:
The TathÄgata's mind ground, obstructed for vast eons, I have heard.
Now encountering the proclamation, I wish you to explain in detail.
The master said:

The precepts of the Ganges sands, hoping to encounter the proclamation, I wish. I only wish that the precept master will have compassion and explain in detail - my mind is cool and ashamed, not daring to conceal.
Revealing the heart and liver, confessing and repenting.
Vast eons ago, the obstructions of the Ganges sands.
Now hearing this precept, they all attain elimination.
Ashamed and joyful, they give to the precept teacher.
Written in the fourth month of the Ganfu era, at Baoen Temple
